item.title: 美国通胀测试前美元保持涨势
item.description: 周四，美元走稳，收复了前几个交易日的部分跌幅，交易员们期待着本周末美国的一项关键通胀数据，该数据可能会为美国的利率前景提供进一步的线索。【原文：The dollar steadied on Thursday as it nursed some of its steep losses from previous sessions, with traders looking ahead to a key U.S. inflation reading at the end of the week that could offer further clues on the outlook for rates there.】

item.title: 新日铁将对美国钢铁厂追加投资
item.description: 日本最大的钢铁制造商新日铁公司周四表示，作为其即将收购美国钢铁公司的一部分，该公司计划向美国钢铁公司的两家钢厂追加约 13 亿美元的投资。【原文：Japan's biggest steelmaker Nippon Steel said on Thursday it plans to make an additional investment of about $1.3 billion in U.S. Steel's two mills as part of its pending acquisition of the U.S. company.】

item.title: 美国库存减少抵消利比亚供应中断影响，石油价格持稳
item.description: 油价周四基本持稳，原因是美国原油库存降幅小于预期，以及对中国需求的持续担忧抵消了利比亚的供应中断。【原文：Oil prices held mostly steady on Thursday as a smaller-than-expected draw in U.S. crude inventories and continued worries over China demand countered supply disruptions out of Libya.】

item.title: 增长放缓，J.D. Power 将美国电动汽车销量预期下调至 9
item.description: 咨询公司J.D. Power周三在一份报告中称，今年美国电动汽车（EV）销量预计将仅占市场份额的9%，下调了此前12%的预期。【原文：U.S. electric vehicle (EV) sales are expected to reach just 9% of the market this year, consulting firm J.D. Power said in a report on Wednesday, lowering its previous forecast of 12%.】

item.title: SK Hynix 开发出功耗更低的第六代 DRAM 芯片
item.description: 全球第二大内存芯片制造商 SK Hynix 周四表示，该公司已开发出业界首款第六代 10 纳米动态随机存取内存（DRAM）芯片，其功耗比旧款芯片更低。【原文：SK Hynix , world's second-largest memory chip maker, said on Thursday it had developed the industry's first sixth-generation 10-nanometre dynamic random access memory (DRAM) chip with reduced power consumption than older models.】

item.title: 研究显示：中国对非洲的贷款七年来首次增长
item.description: 一项独立研究周四显示，中国贷款机构去年向非洲批准了价值46.1亿美元的贷款，这是自2016年以来的首次年度增长。【原文：Chinese lenders approved loans worth $4.61 billion to Africa last year, marking the first annual increase since 2016, an independent study showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 巴西最高法院威胁在周四晚前暂停 X 在该国的使用
item.description: 巴西最高法院法官亚历山大-德-莫赖斯（Alexandre de Moraes）周三命令亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在24小时内为其信息平台X在巴西指定一名法律代表，否则将面临该网站在巴西被暂停服务的命运。【原文：Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes ordered billionaire Elon Musk on Wednesday to name a legal representative for his messaging platform X in Brazil within 24 hours or face the site's suspension in the country, a court decision showed.】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克：现在是降息的 "行动时机"，但要确保万无一失
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周三表示，随着通胀率的进一步下降以及失业率的上升超出了他的预期，现在可能是 "行动起来 "实施降息的时候了，但他希望在扣动扳机之前能够确定这一点。 博斯蒂克说，他希望在美联储 9 月 17-18 日会议之前看到月度就业报告和两份通胀报告确认【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic on Wednesday said that with inflation down farther and the unemployment rate up more than he anticipated, it may be "time to move" on rate cuts, but he wants to be sure before pulling that trigger. Bostic said he will want to see confirmation from the monthly jobs report and two inflation reports due before the Fed's Sept. 17-18 meeting that】

item.title: 有争议的加州人工智能法案获得立法机构通过，正等待州长签署
item.description: 加利福尼亚州立法者周三通过了一项备受争议的人工智能安全法案，之后还需要进行一次程序投票，其命运才会掌握在州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）手中。【原文：California lawmakers passed a hotly contested artificial-intelligence safety bill on Wednesday, after which it will need one more process vote before its fate is in the hands of Governor Gavin Newsom, who has until Sept. 30 to decide whether to sign it into law or veto it.】

item.title: 数据显示，7 月份英国汽车产量连续第五个月下降
item.description: 周四的行业数据显示，受制造商转向新车型和供应链临时中断的影响，英国 7 月份的汽车产量连续第五个月下降。【原文：Britain's car production fell for the fifth consecutive month in July, hurt by manufacturers shifting to new models and temporary disruptions in supply chain, industry data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，折扣零售商 Big Lots 因销售额下降而酝酿申请破产
item.description: 据彭博社周三援引熟悉该计划的人士的话报道，折扣家居用品零售商 Big Lots 正在考虑申请破产，并可能在几周内寻求法院保护。【原文：Discount home goods retailer Big Lots is considering a potential bankruptcy filing and may seek court protection within weeks, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 美国参议员在英特尔实施裁员计划后就芯片奖向英特尔首席执行官施压
item.description: 共和党参议员里克-斯科特（Rick Scott）周三要求英特尔公司首席执行官帕特-盖尔辛格（Pat Gelsinger）提供更多细节，说明该公司尽管将获得近200亿美元的美国拨款和贷款以促进芯片生产，但仍计划裁员15,000多人。【原文：Republican Senator Rick Scott on Wednesday asked Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger for more details on the company's plans to cut more than 15,000 jobs despite being set to receive nearly $20 billion in U.S. grants and loans to boost chip production.】

item.title: 加布里埃尔-加里波洛被选为巴西央行行长，他拥有异端背景
item.description: 加布里埃尔-加里波洛（Gabriel Galipolo）被选为巴西央行下一任行长，他是一位 42 岁的经济学家，并不总是表达主流的正统经济观点。【原文：Gabriel Galipolo, picked to be the next head of Brazil's central bank, is a 42-year-old economist who has not always expressed mainstream orthodox economic views.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳航年度利润下降 16%，宣布额外回购 2.71 亿澳元
item.description: 受燃油成本上升和票价下降的影响，澳航周四公布的年度基本利润下降了 16%，尽管这家澳大利亚旗舰航空公司宣布了一项高达 4 亿澳元（约合 2.7136 亿美元）的额外股票回购计划。【原文：Qantas Airways reported a 16% decline in annual underlying profit on Thursday, impacted by rising fuel costs and lower fares, even as Australia's flagship carrier announced an additional share buyback plan of up to A$400 million ($271.36 million).】

item.title: 英伟达的预测打击了其他科技股对人工智能的热情
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）和其他重量级科技公司的股价周三尾盘下跌，这对投资者来说是一个令人沮丧的信号，因为他们本以为这家人工智能芯片的主要销售商做出的强劲预测会推动华尔街最有价值的公司获得新的收益。【原文：Shares of Nvidia and other technology heavyweights fell late on Wednesday, a discouraging sign for investors betting that a strong forecast from the dominant seller of AI chips would fuel fresh gains in Wall Street's most valuable companies.】

item.title: 美国联邦储备委员会在压力测试后设定大型银行资本水平，对高盛的水平有所放宽
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会周三宣布，已在 6 月份的年度压力测试后为大型银行设定了最新的资本缓冲，但同意减轻高盛的负担。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday it had set the latest capital cushions for large banks following June's annual stress tests, but agreed to shrink Goldman Sachs' burden.】

item.title: 亚洲 Nvidia 等待游戏结束，谨慎降临
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 独家报道政府消息人士称，特斯拉要求加拿大降低对中国产电动汽车的关税
item.description: 一位加拿大政府消息人士周三表示，在加拿大本周宣布对中国制造的电动汽车征收 100% 的关税之前，特斯拉曾与渥太华接触，要求降低其汽车关税。【原文：Before Canada said this week it was imposing a 100% duty on Chinese-made electric vehicles, Tesla approached Ottawa and asked for a lower tariff on its autos, a Canadian government source said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 在美国竞争和通货膨胀的影响下，新西兰航空公司年度盈利下降 61
item.description: 受激烈竞争和高通胀压力的影响，国内和北美市场的旅游需求受到冲击，新西兰航空公司周四公布的年度收益下降了61%。【原文：Air New Zealand posted a 61% drop in its annual earnings on Thursday, hurt by stiff competition and high inflationary pressure, which is impacting travel demand in its domestic as well as in the North American market.】

item.title: Reddit 正在调查美国数千用户的网络中断问题
item.description: 社交媒体平台 Reddit 周三表示，它正在调查影响美国数千名用户的网络中断事件。【原文：Social media platform Reddit said on Wednesday it was investigating an outage that has affected thousands of users in the U.S.】

item.title: 英伟达预测第三季度营收高于预期
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）周三预测第三季度营收将高于华尔街预期，并押注随着越来越多的公司寻求建立人工智能业务，市场对其芯片的需求将大幅增长。【原文：Nvidia forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on sky-high demand for its chips as more companies seek to build our their artificial-intelligence businesses.】

item.title: 惠普在个人电脑市场复苏和人工智能需求的推动下恢复收入增长
item.description: 惠普公司（HP Inc）周三公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期，这是该公司在连续八个季度下滑后首次实现季度营收增长。【原文：HP Inc beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, marking its first quarter of revenue growth after eight consecutive quarters of decline.】

item.title: Chipotle 任命公司资深员工 Adam Rymer 担任财务总监
item.description: Chipotle Mexican Grill 周三任命 Adam Rymer 自 10 月 1 日起担任首席财务官。【原文：Chipotle Mexican Grill on Wednesday appointed Adam Rymer as its chief financial officer from Oct. 1.】

item.title: CrowdStrike 下调年度收入预期，Windows 故障影响新交易
item.description: CrowdStrike 公司周三下调了年度营收预期，这表明其网络安全产品的需求正受到上个月因该公司错误更新而导致的全球 Windows 系统故障的影响。【原文：CrowdStrike cut its annual revenue forecast on Wednesday, in a sign that demand for its cybersecurity products was taking a toll from last month's global Windows outage caused by a faulty update from the company.】

item.title: Salesforce 预测第三季度营收低于预期
item.description: 本周三，Salesforce 预计第三季度营收低于华尔街预期，原因是在经济不确定的情况下，企业云产品支出减少。【原文：Salesforce forecast third-quarter revenue below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, hit by weaker spending on its enterprise cloud products in an uncertain economy.】

item.title: 迪斯尼旗下的 ESPN 签订协议，将在 2037 年之前播出美国网球公开赛
item.description: 迪斯尼旗下的 ESPN 电视网周三表示，已与美国网球协会签署协议，将继续转播美国网球公开赛至 2037 年。【原文：Walt Disney's ESPN signed a deal with the United States Tennis Association to continue broadcasting the U.S. Open tournament through 2037, the network said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：OpenAI 正在洽谈融资，估值超过 1000 亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，热门软件 ChatGPT 背后的初创公司 OpenAI 正在商讨在新一轮融资中筹集数十亿美元，其估值可能超过 1000 亿美元。【原文：OpenAI, the startup behind the popular ChatGPT, is reportedly in discussions to raise billions of dollars in a new funding round that could see it valued at above $100 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 墨西哥央行将 2024 年国内生产总值预期下调至 1.5
item.description: 墨西哥央行周三发布的季度报告显示，墨西哥央行下调了今明两年的经济增长预期，理由是国外制造业需求疲软，而通货膨胀依然顽固。【原文：The Bank of Mexico cut its forecast for economic growth this year and next, according to the central bank's quarterly report released on Wednesday, citing weaker foreign manufacturing demand while inflation remains stubborn.】

item.title: 据 Information 报道，Meta 公司考虑将新型混合现实眼镜作为头显的替代品
item.description: 据《信息报》周三援引社交媒体巨头 Meta Platforms 的两名员工的话报道，Meta Platforms 正在计划推出一款类似笨重眼镜的混合现实设备。【原文：Meta Platforms is planning a mixed reality device that resembles a bulky pair of glasses, the Information reported on Wednesday, citing two employees from the social media giant.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长表示，卢拉将提名加里波洛担任央行行长
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）周三告诉记者，巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）已选定央行货币政策主任加布里埃尔-加里波洛（Gabriel Galipolo）为下一任央行行长，接替任期将于12月结束的罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has picked central bank monetary policy director Gabriel Galipolo to be the next governor of the institution, replacing Roberto Campos Neto whose term ends in December, Finance Minister Fernando Haddad told journalists on Wednesday.】
